Deputy Head of Military Intelligence | strength1 = | strength2 = | casualties1 = | casualties2 = | units1 = Presidential Guard | units2 = 10th Armoured Brigade
Jihaz Haneen | notes = }} {{Ba'athism sidebar}} The '''17 July Revolution''' was a bloodless coup in [[Iraq]] in 1968, led by General [[Ahmed Hassan al-Bakr]], which brought the [[Arab Socialist Ba'ath Party – Iraq Region|Iraqi Regional Branch]] of the [[Ba'ath Party (Iraqi-dominated faction)|Arab Socialist Ba'ath Party]] to power. Both [[Saddam Hussein]], later [[President of Iraq]], and [[Salah Omar al-Ali]], later a Ba'athist dissident, were major participants in the coup. According to historian [[Charles R. H. Tripp]], the coup upset the "US-sponsored security system established as part of the [[Cold War]] in the Middle East. It appeared that any enemy of the Baghdad regime was a potential ally of the United States."{{cite book | author = [[Charles R. H. Tripp|Tripp, Charles]] | page = 203 | title = A History of Iraq | location = | publisher = [[Cambridge University Press]] | year = 2010 | isbn = 978-0-521-87823-4}} The Ba'ath Party ruled from the 17 July Revolution until 2003, when it was removed from power by an [[2003 invasion of Iraq|invasion]] led by American and British forces. Iraq then came under a military occupation by a [[Multinational Force Iraq|multinational coalition]].https://www.cia.gov/library/publications/the-world-factbook/geos/iz.html (The 17 July Revolution is not to be confused with the [[14 July Revolution]], a coup on 14 July 1958, when [[Faisal II of Iraq|King Faisal II]] was overthrown, ending the [[Hashemites|Hashemite dynasty]] in Iraq and establishing the [[Republic of Iraq (1958–1968)|Republic of Iraq]].) ==See also== *[[1963 Syrian coup d'état]] *[[14 July Revolution]] *[[Ramadan Revolution]] *[[November 1963 Iraqi coup d'état]] *[[List of modern conflicts in the Middle East]] ==References== {{reflist|colwidth=30em}} {{Cold War}} [[Category:Arab rebellions in Iraq]] [[Category:History of the Ba'ath Party]] [[Category:Rebellions in Iraq]] [[Category:Conflicts in 1968]] [[Category:Military coups in Iraq]] [[Category:1968 in Iraq]] [[Category:1960s coups d'état and coup attempts|Iraq]] [[Category:Ba'athism]] [[Category:20th-century revolutions]] [[Category:Arab nationalism in Iraq]]
